items.title: Version 1.8.3 is missing on PyPI
items.body: Would be great to see it uploaded there! :)

items.title: Catalog empty and don't know how to set up STATICI18N_PACKAGES
items.body:
Hi guys,

great package. All translations are saved in a locale folder under the main app. Unfortunately, the catalog just shows the standard django stuff if I don't specify STATICI18N_PACKAGES in my settings. If I do specify it as ('django.conf'), then it stays completely empty.

How do I set it to include the locale folder of my main app?

items.title: Issue with custom STATICI18N_PACKAGES in 1.8.0 (Django 2.0.6, py 3.6.5)
items.body:
Hi,

For example, if I set STATICI18N_PACKAGES = ('webui',)

Then:
> python manage.py compilejsi18n --locale en                        
processing language en
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/collioud/Workspace/IPC_Pub_Prep_V7py3/ipcpubprep/manage.py", line 22, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/home/collioud/Workspace/IPC_Pub_Prep_V7py3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 371, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()

  File "/home/collioud/Workspace/IPC_Pub_Prep_V7py3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 288, in run_from_argv
    self.execute(*args, **cmd_options)
  File "/home/collioud/Workspace/IPC_Pub_Prep_V7py3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 335, in execute
    output = self.handle(*args, **options)
  File "/home/collioud/Workspace/IPC_Pub_Prep_V7py3/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/statici18n/management/commands/compilejsi18n.py", line 126, in handle

items.title: Namespacing
Crash on `-p` flag
items.body:
When I try to generate jsi18n file for specific package, it trashes:

```
manage.sh compilejsi18n -p dashboard
processing language en
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./core/manage.py", line 20, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 371, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 365, in execute
    self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 288, in run_from_argv
    self.execute(*args, **cmd_options)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 335, in execute
    output = self.handle(*args, **options)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/statici18n/management/commands/compilejsi18n.py", line 126, in handle
    self._create_output(outputdir, outputformat, locale, domain, packages)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/statici18n/management/commands/compilejsi18n.py", line 91, in _create_output
    data = self._create_javascript_catalog(locale, domain, packages)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/statici18n/management/commands/compilejsi18n.py", line 62, in _create_javascript_catalog
    response = catalog.get(self, None, domain=domain, packages=packages)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/views/i18n.py", line 226, in get
    packages = packages.split('+') if packages else self.packages
AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'split'
```

According to the code, you cannot provide packages as a list. You must join them with "+" sign.

items.title: LANGUAGE_CODE needs to be capital character
items.body:
LANGUAGE_CODE for some languages contains capital chracter (i.e. ko-KR for Korean).

When run command "python manage.py compilejsi18n -l ko-KR",
even if I put ko-KR, the directory always be ko-kr so 404 error happened.

Can it be fixed?

items.title: Where did version 1.3.0 come from and what are the changes?
items.body:
Version 1.3.0 is available from https://pypi.python.org/pypi/django-statici18n/1.3.0
But:

* There is no 1.3.0 in https://github.com/zyegfryed/django-statici18n/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst
* The github releases only go to 1.1.5 https://github.com/zyegfryed/django-statici18n/releases
* master is on v1.2.1 https://github.com/zyegfryed/django-statici18n/blob/master/src/statici18n/__init__.py#L2

items.title: (Separate) Static assets for contrib apps
items.body:
I'm quite new to Django, so this may be a stupid question: how do you generate static i18n js assets for django.contrib apps? In particular I would like to serve the assets for the admin app separately from those for the rest of my app.

Previously I was using `javascript_catalog` to serve jsi18n for my app from `/jsi18n` and just including the admin site's URLs so it's jsi18n was available from `/admin/jsi18n`:

```
#...
urls += [url(r'^jsi18n/$', javascript_catalog, name='javascript_catalog'), url(r'^admin/', include(admin.site.urls))]
```
I've got `django-statici18n` set up and generating static jsi18n files for m app, however those files do not include the admin site i18n translations and, as I mentioned above, I want to serve them separately.

Is it possible to configure `django-statici18n` to generate separate static jsi18n assets for the admin app? And, if so, how?

Edit:

Just to be clear I'm happy enough to run `python manage.py compilejsi18n` (or any other steps) twice in order to generate the separate assets - I've tried `python manage.py compliejsi18n -p django.contrib.admin` but that doesn't appear to work.

items.title: New release tag
items.body:
In order to install `django-statici18n` using version number a new release would be great. 
That release could include the latest mandatory changes for 1.10 like [this one](https://github.com/zyegfryed/django-statici18n/commit/7a3fc13fd3d6e8b770abdcf91e30890cac8fd26d).

items.title: Add version hash to url
items.body:
Hi!
There is a problem when a browser cache old js-file with translation. A good way is adding unique ending to url, for example `?v=hash`.
I implemented this case as a templatetag:

``` python
# coding=utf-8
from __future__ import absolute_import
import os
import hashlib
from django import template
from django.conf import settings
from unipath import Path
from django.contrib.staticfiles.templatetags.staticfiles import static
from statici18n.conf import settings as statici18n_settings
from statici18n.utils import get_filename

register = template.Library()

_JSI18N_URL_CACHE = {}

@register.simple_tag
def get_jsi18n_url(locale):
    url = _JSI18N_URL_CACHE.get(locale)
    if url is None:
        path = os.path.join(statici18n_settings.STATICI18N_OUTPUT_DIR,
                            get_filename(locale, statici18n_settings.STATICI18N_DOMAIN))
        try:
            mod_hash = hashlib.sha1(
                str(Path(settings.STATIC_ROOT, path).mtime())
            ).digest().encode('base64').replace('+', '').replace('/', '')[:8]
        except OSError:
            mod_hash = '0'
        url = static(path) + '?v=' + mod_hash
        _JSI18N_URL_CACHE[locale] = url
    return url
```

and use it in templates:

```
    {% if debug %}
        <script src="{% url 'jsi18n_catalog' %}"></script>
    {% else %}
        <script src="{% get_jsi18n_url LANGUAGE_CODE %}"></script>
    {% endif %}
```

I propose add similar implementation to your package because it is useful.

items.title: Release new version for Django 1.10
items.body: Hi, I see somebody has implemented the support for Django >= 1.8, however, new version still hasn't been released. Could you please give me a time frame of sorts when a new version is gonna be released? I am willing to help with any coding required to release as soon as possible...

items.title: Support `USE_I18N = False`
items.body:
Hi there! This might initially sound a bit of an unusual request, so here's the context:

We have a web application which using django-statici18n, generates the JS locale files at the same location we set in `STATICFILES_DIRS`. This builds the JS files for all locales, and then `collectstatic` moves them over to our `STATIC_ROOT`. So far, so good.

Now here's the trick. The web application can be deployed by individuals at their own will, which also means `USE_I18N = False` is a valid scenario. Under these circumstances, running `compilejsi18n` builds files for **all locales**, even if only `settings.LANGUAGE_CODE` will always be used. At the same time, if run in conjunction with `collectstatic`, a lot of unnecessary files will be copied over to the static files serving location.

One can always manually pass a `-l <code>` flag, however as far as I see, supporting this use-case would be a trivial 2-line change in the management command and it would work transparently. So I wonder whether you would be up to accepting a PR for it?

Thanks in advance!

items.title: Django 1.9 / 1.10
items.body:
Please, add Django 1.9 and 1.10 support.
Under Django 1.9 there is warning: 

```
/django/core/management/__init__.py:345: RemovedInDjango110Warning: OptionParser usage for Django management commands is deprecated, use ArgumentParser instead
  self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
```

In Django 1.10 will be error!

Or is this package dead and without support?

items.title: Path mismatch between template tag and compilejsi18n
items.body:
compilejsi18n directly writes things to a file path it derives from the settings on its own, while the templatetag uses static() to get the URL. This causes problems when using [ManifestFilesStorage](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/contrib/staticfiles/#django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.ManifestStaticFilesStorage) or similar which mangle the filename for cache-busting.

In summary:
- `compilejsi18n` writes to `...../djangojs.js` bypassing the django storage subsystem entirely.
- `{% statici18n en %}` returns `...../djangojs.$hash.js`

The solution appears to be to write to the file through django's storage things.

items.title: compilejsi18n command should skip system checks
items.body: Otherwise it depends on database, which should not be the case for translations

items.title: Django-Appconf specifies 0.6
items.body: Django-Appconf updated their code and released a 1.0 version.  Django-Statici18n requirements specifically states that django-appconf==0.6.  This would not allow users to update to django-appconf 1.0 without issues.

items.title: var catalog remains empty
items.body:
I've followed the steps in the documentation to setup translated JS files and while the .po and .mo files are created as expected and the djangojs.js file is being served correctly but... the included catalog array in that file remains empty.

`var catalog = new Array();`

I'm running both the makemessages, compilemessages and the compilejsi18n steps none of which give me errors but still; the js file is created but without the translated strings.

My locale directory is right in the project root, i have read in some places that this might cause issues but it works fine for 'normal' translations of .py and .html files.

items.title: Add ability to inline the content of the generated JavaScript file
items.body: E.g. through a second template tag like `{% inlinei18n "de" %}` that would create a `<script></script>` block and fill it with the content of the previously generated file.

items.title: Doesn't work in debug mode without a web-server
items.body:
Hi,

it doesn't work in debug mode (when in manage.py runserver) without an external web-server.

Says
[04/Apr/2013 12:39:19] "GET /static/jsi18n/en/djangojs.js HTTP/1.1" 404 1667

This is because django serves urls like /static/ with runserver, rerouting it to the apps, but can't find the path.

So I use cp -R /static/jsi18n/ /<someapp>/static/ trick right now.

Could you please improve installation notes to include this note or maybe something like
if DEBUG:
    patterns += ...

items.title: Does not use storage API
items.body:
Hey,

Actually this will only work with typical staticfiles setup; not for example when static files are stored on Amazon S3. 

Would be cool if it could use STATICFILES_STORAGE.

Cheers,
Piotr
